languageTools.program.agent.rules

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.rules.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ForallDoRule, IfThenRule, ListallDoRule

    public abstract class Rule
extends ParsedObject
    A rule consists of a condition (body) and an action (head). The condition of a rule is a MentalStateCondition. The action of a rule is an ActionCombo. A rule is applicable if the condition of the rule AND the precondition of the action hold. In that case, the action can be selected for execution.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink, W.Pasman added support to store compiled rule.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isRuleSinglegoal

        public boolean isRuleSinglegoal()
        Check if this rule must evaluate as a single-goal rule. A single-goal rule evaluates different from a normal rule: it can use only a single goal base for the entire condition. This is necessary for focus=SELECT rules.
        This is implicit in the actions of the rule: If (at least one) of the actions in the rule is a module AND that module is focus=SELECT, this rule will be a single-goal rule.
        Returns:
        True if the rule is a single-goal rule.

      • setPreCompiledQuery

        public void setPreCompiledQuery(CompiledQuery compiledQuery)
        Associated a pre-compiled query with this rule. This pre-compiled query is a compilation of the mental state condition of the rule and the precondition of the action of the rule into a single query in the KR language used for representing these.
        Parameters:
        compiledQuery - The mental state and action pre-condition compiled to a query in the KRlanguage.

      • getBoundVar

        public java.util.Set<Var> getBoundVar()
        Returns the non-anonymous variables that occur in the condition of the rule. These variables are said to bind variables that occur in the parameters of the action of the rule.
        Returns:
        The variables that bind variables that occur in the action of the rule.

      • run

        public Result run(RunState<?> runState,
         Substitution substitution)
        Evaluates and applies the Rule. First collect all substitutions that satisfy the condition of the Rule. Then apply the rule using the substitutions found. Application is specific for each type of rule.
        Note that there is a fundamental difference between first collecting substitutions and then applying the rule versus applying the rule while one-by-one collecting substitutions. For the IfThenRule rule we cannot randomly shuffle the substitutions in the latter case (and thus cannot randomly pick an action to execute), and for the ForallDoRule the resulting set of substitutions that satisfy the rule's condition might be different as this set might change when executing actions while evaluating the rule's condition.
        Parameters:
        runState - the current run-state of the agent.
        substitution - the global substitution to use for rule application. These are substitutions that hold on the module level encapsulating this rule.
        Returns:
        Result.

      • apply

        public abstract Result apply(RunState<?> runState,
           java.util.Set<Substitution> substset,
           java.util.HashMap<Substitution,java.util.List<SingleGoal>> substGoalLinks,
           Substitution globalsubst)
        Applies the rule using the set of substitutions that validate the condition of the rule.
        Parameters:
        runState - the current run-state of the agent.
        substset - Set of substitutions that satisfy the condition of this rule.
        substGoalLinks - A set of links between Substitutions and lists of SingleGoals that validate the context of the target module with the given Substitution. Is something (not null) only if isRuleSinglegoal().
        globalsubst - the Substitution that holds at the rule's general level - the module level. This is the substi before we applied the condition. Needed in ListallDoRule.
        Returns:
        Result.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String linePrefix)
        Generalization of toString(), allowing the returned string to be indented at various levels. Rules are printed including the trailing '.', and rules representing Modules are printed as a module.
        Parameters:
        linePrefix - What to prefix every line with
        Returns:
        A string-representation of this action rule, or the string-representation of the module this action rule represents.

      • toRuleString

        public abstract java.lang.String toRuleString()
        Version of toString that will automatically pick the correct version of #toIfThenString() or #toForallDoString(). This will usually be the same as toString(), except for a FocusRule. For a FocusRule this will return the same as #toIfThenString(), instead of a String-representation of the rule's target Module that is returned by toString().
        Returns:
        A one-line String representation of this Rule. Should be the result of either #toIfThenString() or #toForallDoString().
